trans-unit.source: Represents a button that can be selected, but not cleared, by a user.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton"></xref> can be set by clicking it, but it can only be cleared programmatically.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that it can contain a single object of any type (such as a string, an image, or a panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> has two states: `true` or `false`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> is a control that is usually used as an item in a group of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> controls.
However, it is possible to create a single <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton>.
Whether a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> is selected is determined by the state of its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> is selected, it cannot be cleared by clicking it.
When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> elements are grouped, the buttons are mutually exclusive.
A user can select only one item at a time within a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> group.

You can group <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> controls by placing them inside a parent or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A> property on each <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton>.
Customizing the RadioButton Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).

To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton>, see [RadioButton Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/radiobutton-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the name that specifies which <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton"></xref> controls are mutually exclusive.

When two or more <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> controls have the same <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A>, a user can select only one <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> at a time.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The name that specifies which <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton"></xref> controls are mutually exclusive.
The default is an empty string.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton.GroupName"></xref> dependency property.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey"></xref> for a radio button is invoked.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs"></xref>.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked"></xref> property becomes `true`.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs"></xref>.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.RadioButtonAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Called by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.OnClick"></xref> method to implement a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton"></xref> control's toggle behavior.
This method toggles the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property.
